intro: Lentiscus mexicana, commonly known as Mexican lentil tree, is a small evergreen shrub or tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, resinous bark and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits containing several seeds. It is well adapted to arid and rocky environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions. Its resin has been traditionally used for its medicinal and aromatic properties.
